name.japanese: リヴァース・マウンテン

description: An extremely tall mountain at one of the points where the four Blues meet, located on the Red Line. It serves as one of two known entrances to the Grand Line. Water from the four Blues flows upward due to the mountain's extreme cold, converging into a fifth canal that descends into the Grand Line.

keyEvents.title: Final Confrontation with Eric at Reverse Mountain
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats face Eric one final time near Reverse Mountain after departing Warship Island.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the final battle of the Warship Island Arc at this significant geographical location.

keyEvents.title: Eric Falls into the Currents
keyEvents.description: After being tricked by Nami, Eric falls into the treacherous currents near Reverse Mountain.
keyEvents.significance: The dangerous waters of Reverse Mountain claim Eric, removing him as a threat.

keyEvents.title: Reverse Mountain Debut
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats arrive at Reverse Mountain for the first time, witnessing the incredible sight of rivers flowing upward toward the peak.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces one of the most significant geographical locations in One Piece - the primary entrance to the Grand Line for pirates from the four Blues.

keyEvents.title: Successfully Navigating Reverse Mountain
keyEvents.description: The Going Merry successfully navigates the treacherous upward-flowing currents of Reverse Mountain with Nami's expert navigation, crossing over the peak and descending into the Grand Line.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the crew's successful passage through one of the most dangerous navigational challenges in the world, officially entering the Grand Line.

geography.terrain: Mountain with five rivers - four ascending from each Blue sea and one descending to Grand Line
notableFeatures: Rivers flow upward due to extreme cold
Convergence point of all four Blues

dangers.description: Hostile water currents and storms force ships to crash into the mountain walls if they don't sail in at just the right angle. Many pirates die before reaching the top.
The upward-flowing water creates dangerous currents that can easily destroy ships or sweep people away.

description: An island in the East Blue that serves as the location of the Dragon's Nest, which rises from the ocean every 1000 years as the nesting grounds for the Sennenryu dragons.

keyEvents.title: Apis Stays to Protect the Island
keyEvents.description: Apis makes the decision to remain on Warship Island to protect the Dragon's Nest as the Straw Hats depart for the Grand Line.
keyEvents.significance: Provides closure to the Warship Island Arc and establishes Apis as the permanent guardian of the island and its dragons.

notableFeatures: Ancient nesting grounds for Sennenryu dragons
